parts.text:
```json
{
"application": "Singularity",
"details": {
"job_name": "collagen_quantification",
"nodes": 1,
"tasks": 1,
"cpus_per_task": 1,
"memory": "100gb",
"time": "01:00:00",
"output_file": "collagen_seg_quantification_%j.out",
"image": "collagen_segmentation_latest.sif",
"python_script": "Collagen_Segmentation/CollagenQuantify.py",
"test_image_path": "/blue/pinaki.sarder/samuelborder/Farzad_Fibrosis/Same_Training_Set_Data/Results/Ensemble_RGB/Testing_Output/",
"bf_image_dir": "/blue/pinaki.sarder/samuelborder/Farzad_Fibrosis/Same_Training_Set_Data/B/",
"f_image_dir": "/blue/pinaki.sarder/samuelborder/Farzad_Fibrosis/Same_Training_Set_Data/F/",
"output_dir": "/blue/pinaki.sarder/samuelborder/Farzad_Fibrosis/Same_Training_Set_Data/Results/Ensemble_RGB/Collagen_Quantification/",
"threshold": 0.1
}
}
```

This script uses Singularity to run a Python script called "CollagenQuantify.py". Singularity is a containerization technology that allows for the packaging and distribution of software environments, making it easier to run applications across different systems.

The script defines several resource requirements for the job, including the number of nodes, tasks, CPUs per task, memory, and runtime. It also defines the output file for the job. The script then loads the Singularity image "collagen_segmentation_latest.sif" and executes the Python script within the container. The script also includes several command-line arguments that specify the input and output directories for the analysis, as well as the threshold for collagen segmentation.
